name: Visionable Global
slogan: Video collaboration platform designed for healthcare teams’ advanced clinical needs
description:
Visionable is a fast-growing healthtech company on a mission: to make healthcare more equitable and accessible for everyone on the planet. Visionable’s video collaboration platform empowers healthcare teams around the world to design more effective, efficient ways of working, so they can deliver the best possible care, anytime, anywhere.

With deep roots in healthcare policy, innovation and technology integration, our team works with the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) and other global health organisations on change for today, as well as with strategic partners on future-forward 5G innovation projects, including our recent 5G connected ambulance trial with O2 and Samsung.

Already in wide use across Britain’s National Health Service, Visionable is currently expanding its global presence, with offices in London, Kent, Mumbai and various locations in the US. Recent media features have included BBC World News, Forbes and the Financial Times,as well as many specialist health publication

team.title: Director of Product
team.name: Karen Percy
team.bioHtml: Global innovator, marketer, matchmaker, designer—an energetic, creative and driven individual who is passionate about start-ups.

jobs.title: Senior Javascript Developer
jobs.description:
About Visionable:



Visionable is a fast-growing healthtech company on a mission: to make healthcare more equitable and accessible for everyone on the planet. Visionable’s video collaboration platform empowers healthcare teams around the world to design more effective, efficient ways of working, so they can deliver the best possible care, anytime, anywhere.

With deep roots in healthcare policy, innovation and technology integration, our team works with the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) and other global health organisations on change for today, as well as with strategic partners on future-forward 5G innovation projects, including our recent 5G connected ambulance trial with O2 and Samsung.

Already in wide use across Britain’s National Health Service, Visionable is currently expanding its global presence, with offices in London, Kent, Mumbai and various locations in the US. Recent media features have included BBC World News, Forbes and the Financial Times, as well as many specialist health publications.  


This position is for a full-time, Senior Javascript Developer with up to 10 years of experience. You will be working closely with our global tech teams based in the USA and UK as well as our CIO.

Key Responsibilities:


Coding
Designing
Global collaboration with our USA Development team

Requirements

Solid Javascript Development experience - 10+ years experience 
Java/C/C++
Data structure and algorithms
Web RTC
Audio (Opus, iSAC, iLBC, SPEEK, G711, G723, RTAudio)
Video (H.264, H.265, VP8, VP9, MPEG 1,2, 4, AV1)
RTP, RTCP, SIP, XMPP
Streaming server experience is a PLUS
Prior experience with Chat
Video development experience
VoIP
File Transfer, Screen Share client is a preferred. 

Benefits:


25 days annual leave + public holidays
Birthday benefit - receive an Amazon gift card on your birthday!
Fast paced and fast growing tech start up
Remote working with a team of Developers across the North East USA
Career development
Global expansion - UK, USA & India
Competitive salary

....as we begin our journey we're in the process of exploring the best benefits we can provide our colleagues. Along with time our colleagues will have the option to chose the best benefits for them.

Visionable values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, colour, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a Recruiter or agency submits a candidate’s profile/CV without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the Recruiter or agency.

jobs.title: UX Writer - 3 month contract
jobs.description:
About Visionable:


Visionable is a fast-growing health-tech company on a mission: to make healthcare more equitable and accessible for everyone on the planet. Visionable’s video collaboration platform empowers healthcare teams around the world to design more effective, efficient ways of working, so they can deliver the best possible care, anytime, anywhere.

With deep roots in healthcare policy, innovation and technology integration, our team works with the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) and other global health organisations on change for today, as well as with strategic partners on future-forward 5G innovation projects, including our recent 5G connected ambulance trial with O2 and Samsung.

Already in wide use across Britain’s National Health Service, Visionable is currently expanding its global presence, with offices in London, Kent, Mumbai and various locations in the US. Recent media features have included BBC World News, Forbes and the Financial Times, as well as many specialist health publications.  


About the role

THIS IS A 3 MONTH CONTRACT, THE DAILY RATE WILL BE 300-400 PER DAY

We are transforming our Visionable platforms and have an exciting opportunity for a UX Writer/User Experience Writer or Content Designer (whatever you decide to call yourself), based in our London/Kent offices (plus occasional working from home). The successful individual will work across all of our product lines. You will be expected to re(write) any FAQ and non technical user guides based on updates to these products. As a Writer you will be supporting our platform’s design and help shape the experience by creating meaningful text that helps our end users complete the task at hand. This role will be key in support our UX Designer and the wider Product team but will also be key in collaborating with teams of international doctors and other medical organisations.


You will be part of a cross-functional team in the UK and USA helping to build our forth coming platforms – iOS, Android, Mac, Windows and Web. As a Writer/Designer you will have a portfolio of work that demonstrates content that simplifies and beautifies the overall user experience.


Key Responsibilities


• Support the creating of content across digital and non-digital channels to meet the user and business needs

• Create, iterate and manage user-centred content using analytics, user feedback, user research and other sources of information, as well as contributing to content principles, improvements and patterns

• Work in your team to identify user needs, write and map user stories, design content plans, create and publish content

• Build meaningful relationships with stakeholders across the team on policies/legal and other subject matter experts to ensure content is accurate and consistent

• Collaborating with each team, you will strive to establish a cohesive language and a unified voice across the Visionable products and platforms

• Promote user-centred content designing within the department and beyond

• Manage projects from needs assessment to implementation


Key Requirements


• Minimum 5 years UX Content Writer experience in high-growth, high-energy driven company, with strong understanding of working in an Agile environment.

• Proven track record of using language and it’s placement within an application and designing successful products that users love

• End to end user-centred approach to content design and of the importance of explaining design decisions in a way that other people understand

• Understands how UI patterns impact comprehension

• Hands-on experience from working in a cross functional team doing agile software development and product discovery

• Writes excellent microcopy with exemplary spelling and grammar



....as we begin our journey we're in the process of exploring the best benefits we can provide our colleagues. Along with time our colleagues will have the option to chose the best benefits for them.

Visionable values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, colour, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a Recruiter or agency submits a candidate’s profile/CV without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the Recruiter or agency.

jobs.title: Windows C++ Developer
jobs.description:
Windows C++ Software Developer - 100% Remote, Permanant

Must be located in North East USA. Our USA team of Developers are distributed across the North East and occasionally meet up locally.

About Visionable
 
Visionable is a fast-growing tech company on a mission: to help healthcare teams re-envision and redesign how they work together to deliver care. A member of the 2019 Digital Health London cohort and a recent graduate of the Telefonica new startup program, our advanced video collaboration technology has been tested and adopted within the NHS (the world largest healthcare entity, located in the United Kingdom) and around the globe, and we are now poised to scale both our business and our team.

About the role

This position is for a full-time, remote Developer with 3+ years of experience. You will be working closely with other Developers on cross platform architecture, design and coding to deliver high performance audio, video and data sharing applications for our innovative grid computing enabled solution.

You cannot help but learn constantly in this position, working on our unique product that provides video collaboration technology for many different user audiences on a global scale. Working in a fast paced environment with a small group of dedicated and talented individuals, you will have a chance to make a real difference in an organization that values team member input and firmly believes that work should be challenging and fun.

Key Responsibilities:
Windows development in C++
Cross platform GUI framework development experience
Work within and maintain a lean, clean, cross platform application framework
Help maintain, fix and refactor existing code

Requirements
3+ years of hands on C++ professional experience on the Microsoft Windows platform
Expert with Windows and its development tools including Visual Studio 2017
Experience with Windows SDK including GUI and socket programming
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Quiet dedicated home office with a reliable high-speed Internet connection


The ideal candidate will have:
Experience working with Windows audio and video SDKs
Experience working with the Qt framework including Qt Creator
Familiarity developing on Linux and/or MacOS
BSEE/BSCS
Strong attention to detail and an understanding of good software design practices
Experience working remotely, with the ability to stay focused in a dedicated home office

Benefits:
25 days annual leave + public holidays
Birthday benefit - recieve $50 Amazon gift card on your birthday!
Fast paced and fast growing tech start up
Remote working with a team of Developers across the North East USA
Career development
Global expansion - UK, USA & India
Competitive salary

....as we begin our journey we're in the process of exploring the best benefits we can provide our colleagues. Along with time our colleagues will have the option to chose the best benefits for them.


Visionable values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, colour, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a Recruiter or agency submits a candidate’s profile/CV without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the Recruiter or agency.
